Data: 8.6;1;Umar Gul to Haddin, 1 run attempted yorker, swinging in, ended up being a low full toss on leg stump, Haddin missed out this time, tried to flick it past square leg, got a faint inside edge onto his pads;
Tanvir to Clarke, no run good length on the off stump, reaches forward and pushes it to mid-off
Tanvir to Clarke, no run pushing it a touch fuller on the off, same result, defended to mid-off
Tanvir to Clarke, no run angling it away from the right hander, gets across to dent the movement and plays it to cover
Tanvir to Clarke, no run held its line this time, short of a length outside off, punched towards point
Tanvir to Clarke, 2 runs quick single puts pressure on Gul as he runs in from mid-on, just dropped short of him and Clarke set off, Gul ran over it and conceded another run

Tanvir to Clarke, 1 run overthrows this time, sloppy stuff, fielded nicely with a stylish slide to his right and embarassed himself with a needless throw at the non-striker's end to throw away another run
Arafat to Clarke, no run fullish on the off, stroked firmly to mid-off
Arafat to Clarke, no run Clarke is handling this well, tight line, he moves front and across and defends it solidly wide of the bowler
Arafat to Clarke, no run firmly struck but straight to point, slightly short outside off, cut away but doesn't find the gap
Arafat to Clarke, no run stands tall and drives on the up, but back to the bowler, can Arafat pull off his second consecutive maiden?

Arafat to Clarke, (no ball) nope, oversteps and almost had him lbw, offcutter, slower that Clarke failed to pick, moved well across to work it away, was struck in line and would have hit leg, too bad though

Arafat to Clarke, FOUR runs went after it, was standing well outside leg and the bowler chased him, tried to get it into the blockhole, Clarke reached forward and managed to squeeze it wide of mid-on, didn't time it well but had enough on it to take it to the boundary
Arafat to Clarke, 1 run shortish on middle, jumps up and he pushes it uppishly wide of a diving midwicket for a single
Tanvir to Clarke, no run bringing it back in, fullish on the off, pushed back to the bowler
Tanvir to Clarke, no run not much pace, but has been accurate in this second spell, tight line on the off stump, tries to play it to point, gets a thick inside edge back to the bowler
Tanvir to Clarke, FOUR runs classy, too straight this time, in the zone for Clarke, who gets a stride across and whips it away between midwicket and mid-on, using his wrists, 50 up
Tanvir to Clarke, FOUR runs he's spoiling it for Tanvir here, just a fraction overpitched on the off stump, his eyes light up and he drills it along the ground past the bowler for another four
Tanvir to Clarke, no run too wide of the crease and darting it in, defended on the leg side
Tanvir to Clarke, no run short of a good length on the off, punched wide of mid-off
Arafat to Haddin, 2 runs misfield, what are the Pakistanis doing? Driven on the up wide of mid-off where Younis gifts a couple, letting it through is legs
Arafat to Haddin, no run some late movement there, length on the off and moved away, but he opened the face to play it to cover
Arafat to Haddin, no run short on middle and leg, tickled to square leg
Arafat to Haddin, no run full on the off, presents the full face to play it to mid-off, went off the middle
Arafat to Haddin, 2 runs finally, just marginally wide and he guides it wide of point, and third man, for two runs
Arafat to Haddin, 1 run back of a length on middle, punched to mid-on off the back foot, quick single taken
Afridi to Haddin, no run tossed up on the off, pushed through the line to mid-off
Afridi to Haddin, no run slightly short on middle, punched off the back foot towards the bowler
Afridi to Haddin, no run on middle and off, gets forward and blocks on the off side
Afridi to Haddin, no run much fuller, giving it air, defends with a lunge
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run flighted on middle, pushed down the ground to long-on
Afridi to Clarke, no run short of a length on the off stump, gets back and drops it short of cover, quiet start against the spinner
Arafat to Haddin, 1 run another misfield, atrocious stuff, Shehzad at midwicket lets it through this time, one more run conceded
Arafat to Clarke, no run back of a length on middle and off, defended to cover
Arafat to Clarke, FOUR runs excellent timing, back of a length, gets front and across and bunts it back past the bowler, played with a straight bat to beat both mid-on and mid-off, Pup's looking good
Arafat to Clarke, no run offcutter, bowled at 119.7 kmph, pushed back to the bowler
Arafat to Clarke, 1 wide straying in line now, pushed it wide of leg stump, given a wide, Pakistan have a looked sloppy after that double-strike
Arafat to Clarke, no run back of a length on the off, defended back to the bowler
Arafat to Clarke, no run short of a good length on middle, gets across and pushes it to midwicket
Afridi to Haddin, no run dipping into the right hander, closes the face and plays it back to the bowler
Afridi to Haddin, no run on middle, gets forward and turns it into the leg side
Afridi to Haddin, no run flighted on middle, gets across and pushes it wide of midwicket, Afridi has kept things quiet in his short spell so far
Afridi to Haddin, no run full on middle, waits for it and brings his bat down to block that into the leg side
Afridi to Haddin, no run on middle and off, spun away, pushed it wide of Afridi who dives to his left to save another single
Afridi to Haddin, no run good bowling, pushes in a googly, short on the off and spins in, defended off the back foot
Malik to Clarke, 1 run flighted on the off, pushed down the ground to long-off
Malik to Haddin, no run outside off, gets across the line to work it wide of the bowler, is hit on the pads
Malik to Haddin, no run gets forward and plays it to midwicket
Malik to Haddin, no run shortish on the off, reaches forward and drops it into the leg side
Malik to Haddin, 1 run tossed up on the off, driven down the ground to long-on
Malik to Clarke, 1 run comes down the track and bunts that to long-on to keep the strike. tidy start from Malik
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run tossed up on the off stump, takes it on the full and drives it wide of long-off, thinks of a second but it's not there
Afridi to Haddin, no run short on the off and spinning away, struck straight to cover
Afridi to Haddin, no run short on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
Afridi to Haddin, no run flighted on the off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
Afridi to Haddin, no run on the off stump, blocked towards cover, comes half-forward
Afridi to Haddin, 1 run a googly tossed up on the off from wide of the crease, gets a thick inside edge wide of square leg as he tries to play forward, Afridi has been impressive

Malik to Haddin, OUT bowled'im! A conventional offpsinner, landed on the off and spun in, Haddin moves well across to turn it into the leg side, missed and the ball clipped the leg stump, exposed his stumps there and paid the price
Malik to Symonds, no run good length outside off, gets forward and drops it on the pitch
Malik to Symonds, no run slightly short, gets to the pitch and dabs it into the off side
Malik to Symonds, no run on the off stump, similar ball, identical result

Malik to Symonds, no run appeal for lbw, short of a length outside off and spun back in to strike him on the pads as he tried to work it away, moved a little across, and replays indicate he may have just been struck in line, marginal call that
Malik to Symonds, no run
Afridi to Clarke, no run
Afridi to Clarke, no run flighted on the off, pushed off the front foot to cover
Afridi to Clarke, FOUR runs short and wide, errs in length and pays, cuts it away behind point for a welcome boundary
Afridi to Clarke, no run drifting into the pads, comes down the track and kicks it away
Afridi to Clarke, no run appeal for lbw, the straighter one, drifting in towards middle, reaches forward and is struck on the pads, but just outside the line

Afridi to Clarke, FOUR runs important runs these, fraction short and he's onto it in a flash, steps away and slashes it wide of point for another four, two mistakes in this over and both have been dealt with
Malik to Symonds, no run on the off stump, gets forward and taps it into the off side
Malik to Symonds, no run gets down to sweep, spins in to hit him on the pads, outside the line again
Malik to Symonds, no run shortish on the off, pushed through straight to cover off the back foot
Malik to Symonds, no run gets outside the line and is struck on the pads again, he's been kept on a leash so far
Malik to Symonds, no run tossed up, driven back to the bowler, the pressure builds
Malik to Symonds, no run short on middle, played back to the bowler, finishes off with a maiden, excellent bowling
Afridi to Clarke, no run spun away, pitched outside leg and moved in towards middle, padded it awkwardly
Afridi to Clarke, no run fell just short, full on middle, pushed back uppishly but just in front of a diving Afridi
Afridi to Clarke, no run on middle and off, held it back, comes down the track and defends

Afridi to Clarke, no run missed out there, short on the off, attempted googly gone bad, rocked back to pull it away over midwicket, was a little too early into the shot, got an inside edge onto his pads
Afridi to Clarke, no run quicker one on the off stump, defended to cover
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run short outside off, moves away and bunts it to deep cover
Malik to Clarke, no run tossed up on middle and leg, tickled to short fine
Malik to Clarke, no run pushed off the front foot to cover, thinks of a single but Younis is onto it quickly
Malik to Clarke, no run short on the off, gets back and defends it on the pitch
Malik to Clarke, no run down the track, closes the face and turns it to midwicket
Malik to Clarke, 1 run quicker one on middle and leg, spun back in sharply, worked away wide of short fine for a single
Malik to Symonds, 1 run Symonds gets off the mark off his 12th ball, gets across and works it away wide of midwicket for a quick single, he'll be relieved now
Afridi to Symonds, 2 runs tossed up outside off, paddles it well wide of square leg, wide of fine leg for a couple
Afridi to Symonds, no run shortish on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Afridi to Symonds, no run gets back and pushes it to midwicket, slightly short on middle
Afridi to Symonds, no run flighted on the off, reaches forward and drops it short of cover
Afridi to Symonds, FOUR runs just a fraction short and he latches onto it, gets back and pulls it away to beat the gap between deep midwicket and deep square leg

Afridi to Symonds, OUT trapped in front, held its line, landed on a good length on middle, was half-forward while playing at it, was expecting it to turn away but was beaten by the straighter one to be struck in line, big blow that, the spinners have done it again
Malik to Clarke, no run on middle and off, gets on the back foot and defends into the leg side
Malik to Clarke, no run flighted on the off, comes down the track and drives it back to the bowler
Malik to Clarke, no run pushed off the front foot to cover
Malik to Clarke, 1 run flighted on the off, turned away wide of square leg for a single
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run short on the off, gets back and punches it down the ground to long-on
Malik to Clarke, no run short of a length outside off, tapped to cover off the back foot, another quiet over
Afridi to Ferguson, no run flighted on middle and off, defended with a lunge
Afridi to Ferguson, no run tossed up on the off, driven off the front foot to cover
Afridi to Ferguson, no run held it back, dropped it sightly short, defended on the pitch
Afridi to Ferguson, FOUR runs too full there, flighted, inviting him into the drive, Ferguson obliges, gets the pitch and creamed it between cover and mid-off, sweetly struck
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run googly, covers it well, gets outside the line and plays it wide of square leg
Afridi to Clarke, no run the straighter one on middle, gets outside the line and defends into the leg side
Ajmal to Ferguson, FOUR runs under pressure, short outside off, got back and punched it firmly through the covers, brings up the 100 for Australia
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run short on the off, gets back and pushes it to midwicket
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run short and wide, not got his length right here, struck away to deep cover
Ajmal to Clarke, 1 run on the off stump, maintaining a shortish length, turns it wide of midwicket for a quick single
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run much fuller, outside off, gets across and is hit on the pads as he tries to turn it away
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run pushes him on the back foot, all six balls the conventional offspinners, hasn't bowled his doosra yet, defended to cover
Malik to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off, tempted him into trying the slog-sweep, Clarke misses
Malik to Clarke, 1 run tossed up, converts it into a full toss and drives it to long-on
Malik to Ferguson, no run tossed up on the off, spinning in, defended back to the bowler
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run held it back, dropped it short, pushed back past Malik to long-on
Malik to Clarke, no run on middle and off, got back and defended it to midwicket
Malik to Clarke, no run gave it some air again, gets outside off and drops it short of midwicket
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run tossed up outside off, pushed to midwicket
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run short on the off, not much conviction there, played it back to the bowler, they're struggling to even get the singles here
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run slightly short, punched down the ground to long-off
Ajmal to Clarke, no run turned away off the back foot to square leg
Ajmal to Clarke, no run oooh, pushed through quick and almost trapped him in front, gets back to defend and is rapped on the pads, but the faint inside edge saves him, spun in sharply
Ajmal to Clarke, 1 run counters the spin well this time by getting to the pitch and sweeping it to deep midwicket
Malik to Clarke, 1 run gets his foot across the line to paddle it towards deep square leg
Malik to Ferguson, no run short on the off, reaches forward to defend it into the off side
Malik to Ferguson, no run
Malik to Ferguson, no run shortish on middle, pushed away to midwicket off the back foot
Malik to Ferguson, no run fails to beat the gap again, whips it to square leg, struggled to beat the in-field here
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run resorts to the paddle again, played wide of square leg this time for a single to keep the strike
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run tossed up on the off, spins in and he blocks it
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run short outside off, spins back in again, defended off the back
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run flighted outside off, defended once again, there are enough gaps but they just aren't looking for runs here
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run pushed away off the back foot into the leg side
Ajmal to Ferguson, 2 runs tossed up outside off, finally the paddle, they get a couple wide of deep square leg
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run gets on the back foot and punches it to long-off, three off the over
Malik to Ferguson, no run plants his foot forward to defend, the grind continues
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run driven down the ground to long on
Malik to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off, opens the face to guide it to point
Malik to Clarke, no run pushed away off the back foot to midwicket, another dot ball
Malik to Clarke, 1 run fetches it from outside off and paddles it down to fine leg, just a single
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run firmly struck, short on the off, struck down to deep midwicket, still not enough
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run sticking to regular offspin here, worked off the back foot to square leg
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run tickled down to fine leg for a single, Pakistan won't mind this at all
Ajmal to Clarke, no run flighted on the off, gets across and just taps it to midwicket
Ajmal to Clarke, 1 run takes a couple of steps forward and drives it down the ground to long-off
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run on and outside off again, turned to midwicket

Ajmal to Ferguson, no run failed to pick the straighter one there, tossed up, brought him forward and he played inside the line expecting it to spin in and drove at it, missed it in the end but retained his balance to ensure he didn't step out of the crease
Malik to Clarke, 1 run on middle and leg, down the track and pushed to long-on
Malik to Ferguson, no run flighted on the off, gets in front and drives it straight to midwicket
Malik to Ferguson, no run struck away to square leg off the back foot
Malik to Ferguson, no run short and wide, gets back and chops it down to short third
Malik to Ferguson, no run gets well outside the line to paddle and is almost bowled as it zips in to just evade the leg stump
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, paddled to fine leg for a single
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run short on middle and off, whipped away behind square
Ajmal to Clarke, no run back of a length, punched to cover off the back foot
Ajmal to Clarke, 2 runs dropped it short, made room and cut it away behind point for a couple
Ajmal to Clarke, no run shortish on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
Ajmal to Clarke, 2 runs gets to his fifty by tickling it fine for a couple, the message appears clear now, they've looked to get going this over
Ajmal to Clarke, no run flighted outside off, gets across to paddle, is hit on the pads
Malik to Ferguson, 1 leg bye on middle and leg, pushed away wide of midwicket
Malik to Clarke, (no ball) 2 runs takes a couple of steps and turns it down to fine leg, oversteps, so freehit time
Malik to Clarke, 1 run straighter one bowled quick and short outside off, swatted down to long-off, came onto him a little too quickly there, had shaped himself up for a pull
Malik to Ferguson, no run slower one this time, pushed short, tries to cut, is a little too early into it, misses
Malik to Ferguson, 1 run tossed up on middle, swept down to fine leg for a single
Malik to Clarke, no run flighted on middle, charges down the track and drives it back to Malik
Malik to Clarke, 1 run slightly short outside off, makes room and chops it wide of point for a single
Ajmal to Clarke, FOUR runs short on the off stump, makes room and crashes it through the covers for a much-needed boundary
Ajmal to Clarke, 1 run chased him as he stepped away, dropped short of cover for a quick single
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run shortish on the off stump, whipped away towards deep square leg for a single
Ajmal to Clarke, no run quicker through the air, bowled at 93.4 kmph, comes down and pushes it to midwicket
Ajmal to Clarke, 1 run full on middle, turned away to deep square leg for a single
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run the doosra, finally, spun away to catch him on the back leg as he tried to defend off the back foot, playing inside the line, but would have probably missed off
Afridi to Clarke, no run tossed up, pitches outside leg and spins in to strike him on the pads as he tries to close the face
Afridi to Clarke, FOUR runs short on leg stump, poor ball, rocks back and pulls it away over square leg, brings up the 50 partnership
Afridi to Clarke, no run short on middle, made room to cut that away, mistimed it to point, is disappointed with himself there
Afridi to Clarke, 1 run googly, quicker one, short on middle, played it wide of midwicket for a single
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run Ferguson plays his trademark shot, gets across to paddle it to fine leg

Afridi to Clarke, OUT caught and bowled, stopped on him a little, dropped it short, spun away, stepped out of the crease and pushed at it, lobbed it straight to Afridi who took a dolly, went through with the shot there, didn't try to adjust to the spin, and paid the price
Ajmal to Ferguson, FOUR runs the paddle works for him, spun in, he dragged it from outside off to play it well wide of fine leg for a boundary
Ajmal to Ferguson, no run gets across the line and tickles it to short fine
Ajmal to Ferguson, 1 run flighted outside off, works it away to deep square leg to give the new man the strike
Ajmal to Hussey, no run tossed up outside off, reaches forward and plays it back to the bowler
Ajmal to Hussey, no run short on the off stump, gets back and punches it to midwicket
Ajmal to Hussey, no run good stuff, dragged it short, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler, three consecutive dot balls in a powerplay
Afridi to Ferguson, no run tossed up on the off stump, pushes it to cover off the front foot
Afridi to Ferguson, no run slightly quicker on the off, opens the face and plays it to point
Afridi to Ferguson, no run six consecutive dot balls, short on the off, fails to pierce the gap, plays it straight to point
Afridi to Ferguson, no run tossed up outside off, was already into the paddle sweep before the ball was delivered, clipped his pads on the way to short third
Afridi to Ferguson, no run what an over, short outside off, punched straight to cover, is this a maiden now?
Afridi to Ferguson, no run googly, waited for it, hung his bat out, got the inside edge onto his pads, brilliant stuff from Afridi, Australia just haven't had any clue
Arafat to Hussey, 1 run good length on middle, driven down the ground to long-on
Arafat to Ferguson, 1 run slower one, bowled at 114.2 kmph, cut back in, got back and pushed it to long-on
Arafat to Hussey, 1 run straying on the pads, see, they are able to negotiate these guys much better, flicked away to deep square leg
Arafat to Ferguson, no run offcutter, gets away with a wide there, down the leg side, should have been given, or maybe not, replays show it went over leg stump
Arafat to Ferguson, 1 run slower one, the third in a row, at 114 kmph, pulled away to deep square leg
Arafat to Hussey, 1 wide definitely a wide this time, full outside leg stump, given
Arafat to Hussey, no run back of a length on middle, defended back to the bowler, five of the over, Australia will not be too happy
Afridi to Ferguson, no run kept low, spun away, he prepared himself for a cut, didn't connect
Afridi to Ferguson, no run spun away sharply to beat the outside edge, landed on middle and zipped away as he got back to defend, well done
Afridi to Ferguson, 1 run flighted on middle, bunts it down the ground to long-on
Afridi to Hussey, no run drifting into the batsman, was the googly, got back and dropped it towards midwicket
Afridi to Hussey, no run googly again, kept low, short on the off, spun back in, got an inside edge onto his pads
Afridi to Hussey, 1 run bowled from wide of the crease, tickled it behind square leg, just two off the over
Arafat to Hussey, no run struck firmly but straight to cover, full on the off stump, fails to pierce the field
Arafat to Hussey, 1 run short of a length on middle, drops it wide of the bowler and sets off for a single
Arafat to Ferguson, no run banged it short,saw him make some room, evaded it in the end, another dot ball
Arafat to Ferguson, 1 run slower one bowled on a good length on the off, pushed to cover off the back foot, the struggle continues, Arafat has bowled ten deliveries not giving away too much
Arafat to Hussey, 1 run slower offcutter, pushed towards long-on for a single
Arafat to Ferguson, 1 run back of a length on leg stump, punched towards long-on again,
Umar Gul to Ferguson, no run slower one on the off, chops it short of point, mistimed a cut there
Umar Gul to Ferguson, 1 wide bouncer down the leg side, called a wide, will they even reach 200 here?
Umar Gul to Ferguson, FOUR runs finally, a fraction overpitched, he moved away and creamed it through the covers, went off the middle, four valuable runs
Umar Gul to Ferguson, 2 runs two more, full on the off, made room to drive it into the gap between long-off and deep cover

Umar Gul to Ferguson, OUT was in the slot, struck it well, had a nice swing at it but there was fielder there perfectly positioned for that shot, hit towards long-on where Tanvir just had to take a couple of steps back to snap that one
Umar Gul to Hussey, no run good pace, good length on the off at around 135 kmph, played back to the bowler
Umar Gul to Hussey, 2 runs slower one, an offcutter, makes room, opens the face to guide it wide of point for a couple
Ajmal to Hauritz, no run tossed up outside off, gets across and defends it short of midwicket
Ajmal to Hauritz, no run flighted on the off, pushes it back to the bowler off the front foot
Ajmal to Hauritz, 1 run tossed up on middle, turned away behind square leg
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 run gave it some air, threw it up on the off stump, moved across and defended it to cover
Ajmal to Hauritz, 1 run slightly short on the off, got back and punched it down the ground
Ajmal to Hussey, no run shortish on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler again
Umar Gul to Hauritz, 1 run fullish on the off stump, drives it down the ground to long-on
Umar Gul to Hussey, 1 run low full toss on middle, pushed to long-on again
Umar Gul to Hauritz, no run beats the outside edge with a legcutter this time, landed on a good length outside off and moved away as he tried to tap that off the back foot
Umar Gul to Hauritz, 1 run slower one on the off, got onto the back foot, dropped it wide of the bowler, and set off
Umar Gul to Hussey, no run slower one on leg stump, pushed it back, they haven't gone after them at all
Umar Gul to Hussey, 1 run full outside off, reached for it, dragged it back past the bowler down to long-on for a single
Ajmal to Hussey, 1 leg bye tossed up outside off, worked it away behind square for a single
Ajmal to Hauritz, no run struck on the jaw, short outside off, slapped it back him, fell just short, brushed his fingers and struck him straight on the face
Ajmal to Hauritz, 2 runs flighted on the off, comes down the track and drives it down to long-on, Shehzad fumbles and allows them to come back for the second
Ajmal to Hauritz, no run short on the off, swatted down the ground

Ajmal to Hauritz, SIX runs Hauritz clears the boundary, the first six of the innings, tossed up on the off, bends down and slog-sweeps it over deep midwicket for a big one, came out of nowehere the way these two were going
Ajmal to Hauritz, 1 run drives it wide of cover off the front foot, a single again
Umar Gul to Hauritz, no run inswinging yorker on the off, dug out back to the bowler, brushed Gul's fingers and crashed into the stumps at the non-striker's end
Umar Gul to Hauritz, 1 run fullish but close to the off stump, pushed down to long-off for a single

Umar Gul to Hussey, OUT gone! Slower one, bowled short on the off, an offcutter that, Hussey failed to pick it, struggled all the way through, tried to pull it over deep square leg, got the top edge as he was a little early into the shot, easy catch to Arafat
Umar Gul to Hauritz, 1 run offcutter, turned away behind square for a single
Umar Gul to Bracken, no run beaten, short of a good length outside off, zipped away to beat the outside edge as he poked at it
Umar Gul to Bracken, 1 run played it wide of the bowler for a single towards mid-on
Arafat to Bracken, 1 run full outside off, swings it down to deep midwicket for a single
Arafat to Hauritz, 2 runs short on middle,. dropped wide of midwicket, some lethargic fielding by Shehzad there, took a while to cut it down and the batsmen are back for the second
Arafat to Hauritz, 1 run short of a length on the off, swatted down to long-on, just a single
Arafat to Bracken, no run bouncer banged in too short, was too high as he went for the hook

Arafat to Bracken, 3 byes poor keeping there, slower one, an offcutter on middle and it moved back in to beat the swing of the bat, Akmal failed to get behind it well, fumbled it to concede byes as Gul chased it down and dragged it back
Arafat to Hauritz, 1 run dragged from outside off towards deep square leg for a single

Pakistan will fancy chasing this. Australia completely lost the plot in the middle overs, once the spinners came on. It was the combo of Afridi and Malik that did the damage, who kept the leash on Clarke and Haddin during their stand. Wickets kept falling at fairly frequent intervals, and even in the last ten, once the seamers came back on,
The Pakistan openers are out. Bracken will bowl, and facing him is Salman Butt. 199 to win
Bracken to Salman Butt, 5 wide runs straightaway, poor start, down the leg side, Butt missed the attempt clip off his pads, and Haddin failed to get behind it, five runs first up
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run short of a good length outside off and came back in, left alone to the keeper, bowled at 122.3 kmph
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run beaten, testing him outside off, moved away just a touch to beat the outside edge
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run and again, just poking at it, fuller, a little wide outside off, reached for it but it moved away to beat the edge

Bracken to Salman Butt, 2 runs came down the track, was bowled much straighter, pushed it wide of midwicket for a couple, a bit if hesitation out there on the middle as there is a fumble from Clarke while running back but all's well
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run teasing him outside off, moved away but he let it go this time
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run good length on the off, moves across and defends it back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, 1 run back of a length on the off, Shehzad was nicely behind it, tapped it wide of midwicket for a single
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, 1 wide down the leg side, given, tries to glance it fine, he didn't really have to, got a free run
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run gets it outside off, moving away from the left hander, Butt has looked uncertain, pushed at it and pretended to withdraw once he was beaten
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run on middle and off, moving away, pushes it uppishly towards cover
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run short of a good length on leg stump, turned to square leg
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, 1 run firmly struck, got forward, presented the full face and squeezed it wide of mid-off but Hauritz id well diving to his right
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, FOUR runs juicy delivery on middle and leg, length ball, flicked away with ease wide of square leg, Pakistan are away
Bracken to Salman Butt, FOUR runs full outside off, chased it, tried to drive it through cover, the ball moved away to take the outside edge, well wide of second slip for a boundary
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run good length outside off, left alone to the keeper, held its line
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run good length on the off, moving back in, defended to cover
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run held it back, bowled at 125 kmph, came back in a touch, stood tall and defended it to cover
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run nipped back in again, he had left his crease, tried to dab it into the off side, got an inside edge onto his pads
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run jumped off the pitch, driving length, Butt left it alone and Haddin took it over his head
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, no run good length outside off, decent pace, around 136.4 kmph, swung away, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, no run came back in, short on the off, got back and defended it back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, 1 run nicely done, fraction short on the off, whipped it away to fine leg
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run zipped away, beaten all ends up, bowled at 135.9 kmph, landed on a good length on middle and moved away late to beat the outside as he moved back to defend
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run slightly short on the off, taps it towards cover
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run shortish on leg stump, takes his bottom hand off to drop it on the leg side
Bracken to Shehzad, no run beaten, Bracken has bowled well, not for the first time is he beating the outside edge, got it to shape away from the right hander as Shehzad came half-forward to defend
Bracken to Shehzad, 1 run a touch too straight, into his zone, worked away wide of midwicket to give his senior partner the strike

Bracken to Salman Butt, 2 runs fraction short, moves across and cuts it away wide of point, third man cuts it off but the throw is slightly wayward, Butt was struggling a bit while coming back for the second
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run slightly short on middle, hit on the ribs as he tries to turn that away
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run held its line this time, landed short outside off and moved away, left it alone
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run testing him outside off, gets across and dabs it to cover
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, no run short on the off, defended short of cover
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, 1 run angling it into the pads, tickled to fine leg
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run good length on middle and leg, defended, walking forward to play it to mid-on
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run short on leg stump, turned to midwicket, in no hurry here
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run bouncer on middle, at 139.4 kmph, Butt ducks under it well

Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run zipped past the outside edge, the late movement almost did him in again, fishing for it with very little foot movement, playing away from his body and is lucky to be there
Bracken to Shehzad, no run much closer to the off stump, still wide enough for him to let it go, came back in just a touch
Bracken to Shehzad, 1 run angling it away, runs it down to third man for a single

Bracken to Salman Butt, no run back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot into the leg side
Bracken to Salman Butt, FOUR runs bent low, rolled his wrists over it, struck it between point and cover, just a fraction short, seized the length early and dispatched it to the boundary
Bracken to Salman Butt, no run slower one, cut back in, countered it well by closing the face to play it to midwicket
Clark to Shehzad, 3 runs bowling to his strength, on middle and leg, worked away firmly wide of midwicket for three runs, Hauritz gives chase, the runs are coming freely
Clark to Salman Butt, no run slightly short outside off, held its line, left it alone
Clark to Salman Butt, 1 run punched firmly towards Clarke at point where a slight fumble allows them a single

Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, no run came back in this time, identical result, played from the crease
Clark to Shehzad, 1 run good length outside off, tries to drive it through the line, gets a thick outside edge to third man, not quite an offside player this guy

Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, 1 run slightly short on the off, punched to cover off the back foot

Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, 1 run short of a good length on the off, dabbed down to third man
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, no run bouncer banged in short on middle and leg, Shehzad ducks under it easily
Hilfenhaus to Shehzad, 1 run banged in short on middle, pulled away to deep midwicket, kept it down
Hilfenhaus to Salman Butt, FOUR runs poor ball, straying on the pads, Butt tickles it fine to beat the fielder in the deep, four more
Clark to Shehzad, no run good length on the off, reaches forward to defend it to cover
Clark to Shehzad, 1 wide slightly short outside off, a legcutter that one, left it alone, a touch too harsh there as he calls it a wide, was within his reach

Clark to Shehzad, FOUR runs charged out and dismissed it over midwicket, swung across the line there but timed it well, cleared the in-field comfortably, a couple of bounces before getting to the ropes, 50 up
Clark to Shehzad, no run back of a length on the off, defended to cover
Clark to Shehzad, no run saw him come down and banged it short, Shehzad adjusted well to back away from it

Clark to Shehzad, FOUR runs four more, slower one banged in short, around 107 kmph, pulled it away over midwicket, didn't time it all too well, but well enough to carry it to the ropes, safe shot, he's opening up

Hopes to Salman Butt, no run good length on middle and leg, moves across and defends it back to the bowler

Hopes to Shehzad, 1 run short of a good length outside off, run down to third man, he's looking pretty fluent now

Symonds to Shehzad, 1 run flighted on the off, pushed wide of point for a quick single

Symonds to Misbah, SIX runs Misbah goes after it, came out of nowhere after that sleep-inducing innings in the first ODI, flighted on middle and he lofted it cleanly over long-on, less than a hundred needed now

Hauritz to Malik, no run appeal for stumping, beat the outside edge, played inside the line and was done in by the straighter one, his foot is just behind the line as he lunged forward, Haddin clipped off the bails and was confident that was out, but replays indicate he was just in
Hauritz to Malik, no run appeal for lbw, rapped on the pads, spun back in sharply to catch him just outside the line, Pakistan are struggling

Hauritz to Malik, no run tossed up on the off, pushed back to the bowler

Clarke to Kamran, no run tosses it up invitingly outside off stump, starts to dip, Akmal hesitates and then goes for a fiesty square-drive, bottom-edging it into the turf

Symonds to Tanvir, no run held its line, he defended outside the line with bat close to pad

Bracken to Tanvir, no run sent back, punched to cover but there's no chance of a single there, 30 needed off the last four now
Hilfenhaus to Malik, 1 run length ball on the off stump, driven firmly down to long-on for a single

Hilfenhaus to Malik, OUT run out, now that's definitely the decisive wicket, slower one outside off, tries to chop it down, gets an under-edge on the bounce to Haddin, Malik sets off for a single, is sent back, an under-arm flick from the keeper crashes into the stumps and the former Pakistan captain is well short
Hilfenhaus to Ajmal, no run fullish on the off stump, pushed off the front foot to mid-on
Hilfenhaus to Ajmal, no run hit by the bouncer, went off the shoulder onto the helmet as he tried to back away
Hilfenhaus to Ajmal, 1 wide wide down the leg side, tries to glance it down fine, misses
Hilfenhaus to Ajmal, no run short of a good length outside off, bowled at 134.9 kmph, backs away from it, takes his eyes off and it just beats the outside edge

That's all we have for today. Australia have bounced back superbly to lead the series 2-1, and Pakistan will have to emulate them to pull of a series win here. Thanks for your feedback. Until the next game on May day, it's goodbye from all of us at Cricinfo. Adios!

Pakistan have a lot to introspect, and again have lived up to their reputation of being extremely erratic. Their shoddy performance with the bat, after having done very well to restrict Australia, has given Australia a potentially decisive 2-1 lead in this series. Pakistan will now have to come up with something special to pull off a comeba

It all went downhill from then on, as batsman after batsman either got out playing a needless shot, or was done in by some genuinely good bowling. Australia kept the pressure on as soon as they sniffed a chance at a comeback, and once they had seized the advantage, they didn't take too long to complete the formalities, despite a determined

What a turnaround. Pakistan were 95 for no loss, and lost all their wickets for 76 runs. The introduction of spin sparked a change in fortunes for Pakistan, with Hauritz getting rid of Butt, and then Clarke taking two in an over.
Australia won by 27 runs
Player of the match is Michael Clarke, AUS
